title: Dorit Kemsley struggles to unload her massive Beverly Hills mansion with more than $5M in price cuts
text:
Advertisement

Times seem to be tough for Dorit Kemsley and her husband PK.

Dorit and PK — who only recently found fame in the television world as stars of The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills — simply can't sell their massive mansion despite more than $5million in price cuts over the course of two years.

The couple initially listed their mansion in the trendy 90210 zipcode for $12.75million in 2017 and recently settled on a $7.5million price tag, with at least seven price cuts in between.

Yikes: Dorit only recently found fame in the television world as a star of The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills and simply can't sell their massive mansion despite more than $5million in price cuts over the course of two years; seen in September

The contemporary-modern property was built at the end of a cul-de-sac and offers top-notch security with an entirely gated compound.

Enjoy views of the Los Angeles skyline through floor-to-ceiling windows across the six bedroom, six-and-a-half bathroom house.

A grand foyer offers a warm welcome into the home, which leads to a chef's gourmet kitchen and a large dining room.

Safe: The contemporary-modern property was built at the end of a cul-de-sac and offers top-notch security with an entirely gated compound

Home sweet home: Enjoy views of the Los Angeles skyline through floor-to-ceiling windows across the six bedroom, six-and-a-half bathroom house

Impressive: A grand foyer offers a warm welcome into the home, which leads to a chef's gourmet kitchen and a large dining room

The grey-and-white-themed kitchen boasts brand new appliances with marble tiled floors and a breakfast nook.

If you're looking to relax in style, a screening room, sauna and wine room add extra entertaining values to the mansion.

Lush landscape surrounds the property, which includes a pool, sundeck and spa — the perfect place to catch some California sunshine.

PK and Dorit purchased the home for $6.5million in September 2016, but seemed to have a change of mind in where they wanted to live and re-listed the home in August for a staggering $12.75million price tag.

Chic: The grey-and-white-themed kitchen boasts brand new appliances with marble tiled floors and a breakfast nook

Luxury: There's no shortage of incredible views of Los Angeles throughout the home, including in the master bathroom

Gorgeous: Lush landscape surrounds the property, which includes a pool, sundeck and spa — the perfect place to catch some California sunshine

Not getting any bites, they dropped the price down to $10.95million in October, followed by another million dollar drop in January 2018 to $9.75million.

The home saw two more price changes before being removed from the real estate market altogether in August 2018, only to reappear in September for $8.745million.

They tried two more attempts at a price tag before settling on their current comfortable goal.

PK and Dorit recently settled a $1.2million court battle after a former business partner accused them of not paying up on a loan.

This year, the couple was also hit with a few federal tax liens worth nearly a total of $1million in back taxes over the course of three years.
description: The couple initially listed their mansion in the trendy 90210 zipcode for $12.75million in 2017 and recently settled on a $7.5million price tag, with at least seven price cuts in between.
